newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-CARDINALS CLINCH TIE FOR CENTRAL TITLE.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-CARDINALS CLINCH TIE FOR CENTRAL TITLE.

text.p: Todd Stottlemyre allowed two runs in 7-2/3 innings and Brian Jordan had three hits and two RBI as the St. Louis Cardinals clinched a tie for the National League Central Division title with a 3-2 victory over the Cincinnati Reds on Monday.
The loss officially eliminated the Reds.

The Cardinals reduced their magic number to one for clinching the Central. They can wrap up their first division crown since 1987 with a win at Pittsburgh on Tuesday or if Houston loses to the New York Mets.
Stottlemyre (14-11) held the Reds scoreless through the first seven innings. He surrendered six hits with three walks and struck out nine.
Rick Honeycutt got the final out of the eighth and Dennis Eckersley worked a perfect ninth for his 30th save as St. Louis snapped a three-game losing streak.

"After losing the first three here, it means that much more to me to get the job done," Stottlemyre said. "I had a lot of motivation coming in. This time of year, its is not hard to get up for a game."

In Atlanta, Jeff Blauser snapped a fifth-inning tie with a two-run single as the Atlanta Braves defeated the Montreal Expos 3-1 in the final regular-season game at Fulton-County Stadium, which was marred by a pre-game bomb threat.
A Braves spokesman said a bomb threat was received by telephone at the stadium, which was temporarily closed as police combed the building for 90 minutes without finding anything.
Greg Maddux and four relievers combined on a five-hitter as the Braves took the final four games of the five-game series. The Expos fell 2-1/2 games behind San Diego in the wild-card race.

In Pittsburgh, Luis Gonzalez cracked a three-run homer and Steve Trachsel allowed four hits over six innings as the Chicago Cubs notched a 4-3 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates, who had their major league-high 11-game winning streak snapped.

With Pittsburgh leading 2-0 in the fourth, Brant Brown and Ryne Sandberg reached on consecutive singles before Gonzalez belted an 0-1 pitch from Jason Schmidt (5-6) over the right-field wall for his 13th homer.
Trachsel (13-9) gave up two runs, walked five and struck out four.
